examples: Just plant a few tomatoes, unless you can freeze or dry them.
He calls it vermilion, but it's just red to me.

subdefinitions.definition: Introduces a disappointing or surprising outcome that renders futile something previously mentioned.

definitions.definition: Used to reduce the force of an imperative ; simply.
examples: Just follow the directions on the box.

definitions.definition: Used to increase the force of an imperative ; simply, without questioning .
examples: I'm tired of playing games – just get it done.

definitions.definition: Used to convey a less serious or formal tone
Used to show humility, earnestness, devotion, etc., during prayer or worship .
examples: Lord, we just want to thank You and praise Your Name.
Heavenly Father, we ask you to just enfold this family with your love as they grieve.
They just left, but you may leave a message at the desk.

subdefinitions.definition: By a narrow margin ; closely ; narrowly ; almost not.
examples: The fastball just missed my head!
The fire department arrived just in time.
He wants everything just right for the big day.

secondary_definitions: ( sentence adverb ) Used to reduce the force of an imperative ; simply.
( sentence adverb ) Used to increase the force of an imperative ; simply, without questioning .
Used to convey a less serious or formal tone
( chiefly Christianity ) Used to show humility, earnestness, devotion, etc., during prayer or worship .
